intro: Vaccinium shaferi, commonly known as the Shafer huckleberry, is a species of shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue to black in color. These berries are often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. Vaccinium shaferi thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, forested areas.
